abstract: Sao Paulo, Brazil, may institute stringent water use policy as last-ditch effort to prevent collapse of Cantareira reservoir water system; reservoir has been reduced to 5.1 percent of its 264 billion capacity due to drought.
lead_paragraph: The worst drought to hit São Paulo, Brazil’s biggest city, in decades may leave many residents with water service only two days a week.
snippet: The worst drought to hit São Paulo, Brazil’s biggest city, in decades may leave many residents with water service only two days a week.

keywords.value: Companhia de Saneamento Basico do Estado de Sao Paulo
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Brazil: Drastic Water Rationing May Be Put in Place in São Paulo
headline.print_headline: Brazil: Drastic Water Rationing May Be Put in Place in São Paulo
